definition: paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc

sentences.english: Use old newspaper to line your kitty litter box or your kitchen garbage can.
sentences.chinese: 用旧报纸垫你的猫沙盒或厨房垃圾桶。

sentences.english: Full-page newspaper ads hawk the fast-selling J3 hatchback.
sentences.chinese: 整版报纸广告都在报道J3的销售。

sentences.english: Do you mind if I borrow theis newspaper?
sentences.chinese: 你介意我借这份报纸吗？

sentences.english: The papers contained no requests for managers.
sentences.chinese: 报纸上没有登招聘经理的启事。

sentences.english: We put the newspapers in neat piles on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 我们在地板上把报纸整齐地叠起来。

sentences.english: W1: There are many famous newspapers.
The paper published an extra to announce the end of the war.
sentences.chinese: 那家报纸出版号外宣布战争结束的消息。

sentences.english: I put up an advertisement in the newspaper for the sale of my car, but there have been no responses so far.
sentences.chinese: 我在报纸上登了卖车广告，但是到目前为止尚无回音。

sentences.english: Ace said , “ My name was in the paper today .
sentences.chinese: 埃斯说，“今天的报纸上有我的名字。”

sentences.english: We are glad to see, newspaper can give community citizen reportorial chance.
sentences.chinese: 我们高兴看到，报纸能给予社区市民报道机会。

sentences.english: The picture appeared in all the Chinese newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 那张照片遍布中国所有的报纸。

sentences.english: He had only known China throgh American newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 他以前只是通过美国的报纸了解过中国。

sentences.english: Include the latest edition of the local paper, magazines that might be of interest or your local “What’s Up?
sentences.chinese: 包括最新版的当地报纸，杂志。

sentences.english: The Anyway company advertised a new product in the newspaper .
sentences.chinese: 安利公司在报纸上为一种新产品做广告。

sentences.english: The words had been cut out of a newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 这些字是从报纸上剪下来的。

sentences.english: Bob Sugg read only certain bits of the papers he sold.
sentences.chinese: 在鲍勃萨格卖的报纸中，他只看一小部分。

definition: to carry a story/to publish (in a newspaper or magazine)
imperial bulletin, palace report dating back to Han dynasty
page of a publication (e.g. newspaper or website)/printing space (reserved for some content)/page layout
